BiblioData.Title: ROTATING TRANSFER DEVICE FOR COMPLEX PATTERNING
BiblioData.Abstract: Preferably a Langmuir (LB) film 105 floats on a liquid 104, especially water. The substrate 102 is coated as it passes through the film 105 at the gas liquid interface. The substrate 102 holder (clamp) 101 is rotated by a motor 106 via gear 107, about a pivot axis 103. The axis 103 may be angled at up to 60{ relative to the film 105. Preferably the flat substrate 102 is mica, single crystalline silicon, glass, quartz, polymer or gold. Preferably the coating is L- a -dipalmitoylphosphatidylcholine (DPPC), nanocrystals, cells, polymers or monomers. Preferably the apparatus includes angular control and linear positioning capabilities. The coated substrates are used for in vitro modeling of biological phenomena, especially axon guidance, cell signaling and proliferation.
